column2: patti, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have used it nightly for 2 weeks & have darker & longer lashes already. The only side effect I have noticed is I get a headache for about 30 minutes after use each use.

column2: heidi girl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this is the best !!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Wonderful but expensive, look for special promotions.

column2: annalync, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This products is great!  I have not experience swelling or discoloration like others have.  I also have dark eyes too, so I don't know if that makes a different. It took about 6 weeks for me to notice longer lashes. Without mascara, you can see the difference in my lashes and with mascara, the lashes look amazingly long. TIP: buy an eyeliner brush and use that as the applicator.  You use less solution and you fully coat the area you need to.  The applicators that come with latisse are too thick and one drop is not enough.

column2: angelical, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been using Latisse for 2 weeks, but I can see new lashes coming in and my 'older' lashes are getting stronger! I have GREAT TIPS; I use 2 eyeliner brushes, one labeled Left, the other labeled Right. I clean them with Dial soap before use to sanitize and because they are so small, I only use one drop of Latisse for BOTH eyes!Place that one drop in lid and dip brushes in. Another tip my Dr told me is after 3 months of use, I should use Latisse every 3-4 nights to maintain! This means 1 bottle will last me 3-4 months, thus saving me a TON of money;) That's always nice!!! Good luck! Be consistent!

column2: tam, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This works great.  I noticed a big change within 4 weeks.  I now only use it every other night.  It did cause discoloration on my eyelid, it just looks like I have a little eye make up on.  Someone told me a good tip.  Put the drop in the lid of the bottle and dip the brush in-then you don't waste any. I have experienced some blurry vision, it seems to come and go.  This definitely does what it says it will.

column2: nana s, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I had to stop using Latisse after 6 days because my eyelids were so swollen, red and itchy.  The Dr. said to wait a week or so and try again.  I did as instructed but had the same reaction again.  I must be allergic to some of the ingredients.

column2: Kaye, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started using Latisse and after the first day my eyelids starting itching and swelling.  I continued to use it for 6 days and my eyes were very red and swollen.  I had severe itching and had to use cold packs to help relieve the discomfort and swelling.  I called my Derm. and she said to discontinue use for a week and then resume using it again.  I did as she suggested and once again, the redness, swelling and itching returned.  I will not use it again.  I paid $200.00 for 2 vials. Unfortunately it turned out to be a big, expensive disappointment for me.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column9: Great eyelash growth medicine. Bought from a physician run site - www.latisse.bx - at $89 per vial - cannot beat that!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It says noticable growth after 2 months, but I've only been using it for 1 month and I already notice the smaller lashes in the inner corners of my eyes getting significantly longer! I'm so excited to see how long they get!

column2: Key West Sandie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: As a child I was a tow-head with very light eyelashes which were abnormally short.  This was fantastic in that they grew out and became lovely and long and curly but NOT dark.  I'm no long blond.  I've used it for the full 4 months and am not sure how to taper off so that I maintain them.  Any info would be heplful.

column2: none, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My lashes are a bit longer and darker, but not that much.

column2: latisseuser, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Awesome easy to use...got a great price with online review of my medical history at www.yourlatisse.com

column2: Del, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Worked for me just like the pictures on their website. Thrilled to have the long eyelashes I had as a girl back again. However - it also makes dark hair grow on my face, around the lower orbital rim. I don't look like Bluebeard or anything - this is short, very fine hair that is easily bleached. Well worth the tradeoff IMO. I'm olive-skinned and rather hairy anyway, so maybe that's it :)

column2: smilingeyes, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: No more caking on mascara!  I never could have imagined how lashes can change your face and enhance your eyes so much!  Love it!

cyclopskitten, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I saw results much faster than expected and have had zero problems or side effects.  I LOVE Latisse!!!

column9: I've read how effective this product is and could'nt wait to try it.  After the first two months I saw some improvements, nothing to bat an eye at but it has been almost three and a half months and my lashes look pretty much the same.

column2: Elvee, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Miss T, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Overall my lashes are stronger and darker in color,but it has only been one week of use.

column2: Dove12 , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The brushes that come with the product are hard and scratched the delicate skin where you are to apply it. I use a tiny clean paintbrush instead.I have inverted eylashes and my eye doctor was pulling 4-5 out every 5 weeks because they were scratching my eye. I have been using Latisse for only 3 weeks and I have not had an inverted eyelash yet, and it has been 5 weeks since he pulled 5 out. My lashes are a bit longer, but even better they are stronger.... no fear of losing lashes when I use the eyelash curler ! My eyelids were a little red for the first few days but they are back to normal now. So far a win,win situation for me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I do not have to use an eyelash curler or expensive mascara and my eyelashes are beautiful - long and sweeping up - one swipe of cheap mascara and I get tons of compliments - great to have "young" eyelashes again!

column2: bevtaim, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It's great going from little or no lashes to full length beautiful lashes no more fake lashes for me.
